statsExpressions 0.6.2.9000

  • Changelog

Dataframe outputs

Indrajeet Patil

2021-01-08

Source: vignettes/web_only/dataframe_outputs.Rmd
dataframe_outputs.Rmd

Introduction

Although the primary focus of this package is to get expressions containing statistical results, one can also use it to extract dataframes containing these details. This vignette catalogs dataframe outputs from all functions.

A dataframe will typically contain the following columns:

  • statistic: the numeric value of a statistic.

  • parameter: the numeric value of a parameter being modeled (often degrees of freedom for the test); note that if no.parameters = 0L (e.g., for non-parametric tests), this column will be irrelevant.

  • parameter1, parameter2 relevant only if the statistic in question has two degrees of freedom (e.g., anova).

  • p.value the two-sided p-value associated with the observed statistic.

  • estimate: estimated value of the effect size.

  • conf.low: lower bound for effect size estimate.

  • conf.high: upper bound for effect size estimate.

For details about the tests and types of effect size estimates they correspond to, see: https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/statsExpressions/articles/stats_details.html

One-sample tests

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "parametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   term                                                                          
#>   <chr>                                                                         
#> 1 "structure(c(0.0155, 0.00029, 0.423, 0.07, 0.0982, 0.115, 0.0055, 0.0064, 0.0~
#>      mu statistic df.error p.value method            estimate ci.width conf.low
#>   <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>                <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 0.275    0.0504       55   0.960 One Sample t-test  0.00665     0.95   -0.254
#>   conf.high effectsize
#>       <dbl> <chr>     
#> 1     0.267 Hedges' g

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "nonparametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   parameter1                                                                    
#>   <chr>                                                                         
#> 1 "structure(c(0.0155, 0.00029, 0.423, 0.07, 0.0982, 0.115, 0.0055, 0.0064, 0.0~
#>   parameter2 statistic    p.value method                    estimate ci.width
#>   <chr>          <dbl>      <dbl> <chr>                        <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 <NA>            5.51 0.00000738 Wilcoxon signed rank test   -0.689     0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high effectsize       
#>      <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>            
#> 1   -0.929    -0.437 r (rank biserial)

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "robust",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 7
#>   estimate conf.low conf.high p.value n.obs effectsize             
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <int> <chr>                  
#> 1   0.0211   0.0107    0.0685       0    56 Robust location measure
#>   method                         
#>   <chr>                          
#> 1 One-sample percentile bootstrap

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "bayes",
  bf.prior = 0.8,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 2 x 11
#>   term       estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference  0.00952  -0.250      0.255 0.532          0.619 
#> 2 Cohens_d    0.276     0.0153     0.536 0.978          0.0525
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale  bf10 log_e_bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 cauchy                          0         0.8 0.130      -2.04
#> 2 cauchy                          0         0.8 0.130      -2.04

Two-sample tests

within-subjects design

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# data
df <- dplyr::filter(bugs_long, condition %in% c("LDLF", "LDHF"))

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  type = "p",
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   term   group     statistic df.error       p.value method        estimate
#>   <chr>  <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>         <dbl> <chr>            <dbl>
#> 1 desire condition      6.65       90 0.00000000222 Paired t-test    0.691
#>   ci.width conf.low conf.high effectsize
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>     
#> 1     0.95    0.465     0.922 Hedges' g

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  type = "np",
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   parameter1 parameter2 statistic      p.value method                   
#>   <chr>      <chr>          <dbl>        <dbl> <chr>                    
#> 1 desire     condition       7.72 0.0000000241 Wilcoxon signed rank test
#>   estimate ci.width conf.low conf.high effectsize       
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>            
#> 1    0.761     0.95    0.600     0.874 r (rank biserial)

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  type = "r",
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 12
#>   statistic df.error       p.value
#>       <dbl>    <dbl>         <dbl>
#> 1      6.71       72 0.00000000375
#>   method                                             effectsize `NULL` estimate
#>   <chr>                                              <chr>       <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 Yuen's test on trimmed means for dependent samples AKP             0    0.621
#>       S     M     L conf.low conf.high
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1   0.1   0.3   0.5    0.385     0.798

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  type = "bf",
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 2 x 11
#>   term       estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference   -1.62    -2.12     -1.14      1               0
#> 2 Cohens_d      0.680    0.449     0.901     1               0
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale     bf10 log_e_bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl>    <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 cauchy                          0       0.707 4762370.       15.4
#> 2 cauchy                          0       0.707 4762370.       15.4

between-subjects design

# setup
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# unequal variance
expr_t_twosample(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "p",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   term  group mean.group1 mean.group2 statistic df.error p.value
#>   <chr> <chr>       <dbl>       <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1 len   supp         20.7        17.0      1.92     55.3  0.0606
#>   method                  estimate ci.width conf.low conf.high effectsize
#>   <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>     
#> 1 Welch Two Sample t-test    0.488     0.95  -0.0212     0.993 Hedges' g

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# equal variance
expr_t_twosample(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "p",
  var.equal = TRUE,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   term  group mean.group1 mean.group2 statistic df.error p.value
#>   <chr> <chr>       <dbl>       <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1 len   supp         20.7        17.0      1.92       58  0.0604
#>   method            estimate ci.width conf.low conf.high effectsize
#>   <chr>                <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>     
#> 1 Two Sample t-test    0.488     0.95  -0.0212     0.993 Hedges' g

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "np",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   parameter1 parameter2 statistic p.value method                 estimate
#>   <chr>      <chr>          <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>                     <dbl>
#> 1 len        supp            6.36  0.0645 Wilcoxon rank sum test    0.279
#>   ci.width conf.low conf.high effectsize       
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>            
#> 1     0.95  -0.0124     0.561 r (rank biserial)

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "r",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 8
#>   statistic df.error p.value
#>       <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1      2.05     45.2  0.0460
#>   method                                               estimate conf.low
#>   <chr>                                                   <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 Yuen's test on trimmed means for independent samples    0.384   0.0401
#>   conf.high effectsize                        
#>       <dbl> <chr>                             
#> 1     0.659 Explanatory measure of effect size

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "bf",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 2 x 11
#>   term       estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference   -3.16   -6.66       0.528 0.960          0.0424
#> 2 Cohens_d      0.416  -0.0277     0.921 0.964          0.0494
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale  bf10 log_e_bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 cauchy                          0       0.707  1.20      0.181
#> 2 cauchy                          0       0.707  1.20      0.181

One-way ANOVAs

within-subjects design

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_parametric(
  data = bugs_long,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 14
#>   term      sumsq sum.squares.error    df df.error meansq statistic  p.value
#>   <chr>     <dbl>             <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 condition  233.              984.  2.63     229.   4.30      20.6 8.27e-11
#>   method                    estimate ci.width conf.low conf.high
#>   <chr>                        <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 One-way analysis of means   0.0783     0.95   0.0217     0.140
#>   effectsize      
#>   <chr>           
#> 1 Omega2 (partial)

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_nonparametric(
  data = bugs_long,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic    df  p.value method                 estimate ci.width conf.low
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>                     <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      55.8     3 4.56e-12 Friedman rank sum test    0.602     0.95    0.602
#>   conf.high effectsize 
#>       <dbl> <chr>      
#> 1     0.818 Kendall's W

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_robust(
  data = bugs_long,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 5
#>   statistic    df df.error  p.value
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      21.2  2.69     191. 4.79e-11
#>   method                                                             
#>   <chr>                                                              
#> 1 A heteroscedastic one-way repeated measures ANOVA for trimmed means

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_bayes(
  data = bugs_long,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 96 x 19
#>    term           estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>    <chr>             <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#>  1 mu                6.88     6.43      7.33  1              0     
#>  2 condition-HDHF    0.912    0.554     1.24  1              0     
#>  3 condition-HDLF   -0.188   -0.548     0.150 0.862          0.737 
#>  4 condition-LDHF    0.455    0.124     0.811 0.995          0.113 
#>  5 condition-LDLF   -1.17    -1.52     -0.823 1              0     
#>  6 rowid-1           0.688   -1.11      2.34  0.779          0.206 
#>  7 rowid-3           1.48    -0.338     3.15  0.952          0.0359
#>  8 rowid-4           0.491   -1.25      2.24  0.709          0.246 
#>  9 rowid-5          -0.814   -2.59      0.930 0.816          0.176 
#> 10 rowid-6          -2.87    -4.68     -1.10  1              0     
#>    prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale effect component          bf10
#>    <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>             <dbl>
#>  1 cauchy                          0       0.707 fixed  extra       1372773375.
#>  2 cauchy                          0       0.707 fixed  conditional 1372773375.
#>  3 cauchy                          0       0.707 fixed  conditional 1372773375.
#>  4 cauchy                          0       0.707 fixed  conditional 1372773375.
#>  5 cauchy                          0       0.707 fixed  conditional 1372773375.
#>  6 cauchy                          0       1     random conditional 1372773375.
#>  7 cauchy                          0       1     random conditional 1372773375.
#>  8 cauchy                          0       1     random conditional 1372773375.
#>  9 cauchy                          0       1     random conditional 1372773375.
#> 10 cauchy                          0       1     random conditional 1372773375.
#>    log_e_bf10    r2 std.dev ci.width r2.conf.low r2.conf.high r2.component
#>         <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl> <chr>       
#>  1       21.0 0.529  0.0330       95       0.460        0.586 conditional

#>  8       21.0 0.529  0.0330       95       0.460        0.586 conditional 
#>  9       21.0 0.529  0.0330       95       0.460        0.586 conditional 
#> 10       21.0 0.529  0.0330       95       0.460        0.586 conditional 
#> # ... with 86 more rows

between-subjects design

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# unequal variance
expr_anova_parametric(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   statistic    df df.error  p.value
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      139.     2     92.2 1.51e-28
#>   method                                                   estimate ci.width
#>   <chr>                                                       <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances)    0.743     0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high effectsize
#>      <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>     
#> 1    0.655     0.803 Omega2

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# equal variance
expr_anova_parametric(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  var.equal = TRUE,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   statistic    df df.error  p.value method                    estimate ci.width
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>                        <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      119.     2      147 1.67e-31 One-way analysis of means    0.612     0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high effectsize
#>      <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>     
#> 1    0.517     0.683 Omega2

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_nonparametric(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   parameter1   parameter2 statistic df.error  p.value
#>   <chr>        <chr>          <dbl>    <int>    <dbl>
#> 1 Sepal.Length Species         96.9        2 8.92e-22
#>   method                       estimate ci.width conf.low conf.high
#>   <chr>                           <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test    0.651     0.95    0.588     0.722
#>   effectsize     
#>   <chr>          
#> 1 Epsilon2 (rank)

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_robust(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic    df df.error p.value effsize conf.low conf.high
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1      124.     2     71.6       0   0.916    0.861     0.984
#>   effectsize                        
#>   <chr>                             
#> 1 Explanatory measure of effect size
#>   method                                           
#>   <chr>                                            
#> 1 A heteroscedastic one-way ANOVA for trimmed means

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_anova_bayes(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 17
#>   term               estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>                 <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 mu                   5.84     5.76       5.93  1               0    
#> 2 Species-setosa      -0.829   -0.947     -0.713 1               0    
#> 3 Species-versicolor   0.0916  -0.0275     0.208 0.936           0.434
#> 4 Species-virginica    0.737    0.618      0.852 1               0    
#> 5 sig2                 0.267    0.210      0.335 1               0    
#> 6 g_Species            2.15     0.188     15.0   1               0    
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale component      bf10 log_e_bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>         <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 cauchy                          0       0.707 extra       1.87e28       65.1
#> 2 cauchy                          0       0.707 conditional 1.87e28       65.1
#> 3 cauchy                          0       0.707 conditional 1.87e28       65.1
#> 4 cauchy                          0       0.707 conditional 1.87e28       65.1
#> 5 cauchy                          0       0.707 extra       1.87e28       65.1
#> 6 cauchy                          0       0.707 extra       1.87e28       65.1
#>      r2 std.dev ci.width r2.conf.low r2.conf.high
#>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>
#> 1 0.612  0.0311       95       0.544        0.667
#> 2 0.612  0.0311       95       0.544        0.667
#> 3 0.612  0.0311       95       0.544        0.667
#> 4 0.612  0.0311       95       0.544        0.667
#> 5 0.612  0.0311       95       0.544        0.667
#> 6 0.612  0.0311       95       0.544        0.667

Contingency table analyses

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)

# create data structure
paired_data <-
  structure(
    list(
      response_before =
        structure(
          c(1L, 2L, 1L, 2L),
          .Label = c("no", "yes"),
          class = "factor"
        ),
      response_after = structure(
        c(1L, 1L, 2L, 2L),
        .Label = c("no", "yes"),
        class = "factor"
      ),
      Freq = c(65L, 25L, 5L, 5L)
    ),
    class = "data.frame",
    row.names = c(NA, -4L)
  )

# ------------------------ association tests -----------------------------

# unpaired
set.seed(123)
expr_contingency_tab(
  data = mtcars,
  x = am,
  y = cyl,
  paired = FALSE,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic    df p.value method                     estimate ci.width conf.low
#>       <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      8.74     2  0.0126 Pearson's Chi-squared test    0.464     0.95        0
#>   conf.high effectsize       
#>       <dbl> <chr>            
#> 1     0.777 Cramer's V (adj.)

# paired
set.seed(123)
expr_contingency_tab(
  data = paired_data,
  x = response_before,
  y = response_after,
  paired = TRUE,
  counts = "Freq",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic    df  p.value method                     estimate ci.width conf.low
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      13.3     1 0.000261 McNemar's Chi-squared test    0.333     0.95    0.164
#>   conf.high effectsize
#>       <dbl> <chr>     
#> 1     0.427 Cohen's g

# ------------------------ goodness of fit tests ---------------------------

# with counts
set.seed(123)
expr_contingency_tab(
  data = as.data.frame(HairEyeColor),
  x = Eye,
  counts = Freq,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic    df  p.value method                                   estimate
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>                                       <dbl>
#> 1      133.     3 9.65e-29 Chi-squared test for given probabilities    0.272
#>   ci.width conf.low conf.high effectsize       
#>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>            
#> 1     0.95    0.222     0.316 Cramer's V (adj.)

Correlation analyses

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "parametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   parameter1 parameter2 estimate conf.low conf.high statistic    df  p.value
#>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl> <int>    <dbl>
#> 1 wt         mpg          -0.868   -0.934    -0.744     -9.56    30 1.29e-10
#>   method  n.obs effectsize
#>   <chr>   <int> <chr>     
#> 1 Pearson    32 Pearson

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "nonparametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   parameter1 parameter2 estimate conf.low conf.high statistic  p.value method  
#>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>   
#> 1 wt         mpg          -0.886   -0.945    -0.774      9.24 1.49e-11 Spearman
#>   n.obs effectsize
#>   <int> <chr>     
#> 1    32 Spearman

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "robust",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   parameter1 parameter2 estimate conf.low conf.high statistic    df  p.value
#>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 wt         mpg          -0.896   -0.948    -0.796     -11.1    30 4.15e-12
#>   method          n.obs effectsize     
#>   <chr>           <int> <chr>          
#> 1 Percentage Bend    32 Percentage Bend

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "bayes",
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   term  estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage prior.distribution
#>   <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl> <chr>             
#> 1 rho     -0.843   -0.934    -0.734     1               0 cauchy            
#>   prior.location prior.scale      bf10 log_e_bf10
#>            <dbl>       <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1              0       0.707 56223033.       17.8

Meta-analysis

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)
library(metaplus)

# renaming to what `statsExpressions` expects
df <- dplyr::rename(mag, estimate = yi, std.error = sei)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_meta_random(data = df, output = "dataframe", type = "parametric")
#> # A tibble: 1 x 8
#>   term    estimate std.error conf.low conf.high statistic  p.value weight
#>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 Overall   -0.767     0.212    -1.18    -0.351     -3.62 0.000295     NA

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_meta_random(data = df, output = "dataframe", type = "robust")
#> # A tibble: 1 x 8
#>   term    estimate std.error conf.low conf.high statistic  p.value weight
#>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 Overall   -0.746     0.234    -1.26    -0.343     -3.19 0.000777     NA

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_meta_random(data = df, output = "dataframe", type = "bayes")
#> # A tibble: 2 x 14
#>   term    estimate std.error conf.low conf.high weight  bf10  rhat   ess
#>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 Overall   -0.654     0.221   -1.10     -0.242     NA  53.0  1    4758.
#> 2 tau        0.486     0.183    0.168     0.845     NA  53.0  1.00 3824.
#>   component prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale log_e_bf10
#>   <chr>     <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 meta      t                               1        0.15       3.97
#> 2 meta      invgamma                        1        0.15       3.97
